page.title: 09LEISURE ACTIVITIES BLYTH
page.content: {ALLOTMENTS} Within our area is a large section set aside for allotments. Many of our dads, grandads and uncles have allotments where they grow vegetables and flowers in their spare time. Some people have greenhouses on their allotments where they can grow tomatoes, grapes, greenpeppers or flowers. Others keep pigeons, rabbits or hens. The pigeons are usually used in races, and the rabbits can be taken to shows where the best one will get a prize. Many allotment holders grow leeks to enter in the leek shows held in the local clubs each September. In the leek show you have to get the white of your leek at least 5 inches long and as fat as possible and if you win you get prizes or money.
